title: Adverbs of Frequency: always, never, sometimes
description: Слушайте и определяйте, как часто что-то происходит.

tasks.audioText: A woman talks about her morning routine. She wakes up early. I always drink water first.

options.text: She drinks water every morning without exception.
She sometimes drinks water in the morning.
She never drinks water in the morning.
She rarely drinks water in the morning.

tasks.explanation: 'Always' means every time, without exception. Option 1 matches this meaning.

tasks.audioText: A man talks about his weekends. He prefers to relax. I never work on Sundays.

options.text: He always works on Sundays.
He sometimes works on Sundays.
He does not work on Sundays at all.
He usually works on Sundays.

tasks.explanation: 'Never' means not at any time. He does not work on Sundays. Option 3 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A girl talks about her lunch habits. She eats at the cafeteria. I sometimes bring food from home.
tasks.transcript: I sometimes bring food from home.

options.text: She always brings food from home.
She brings food from home on some days.
She never brings food from home.
She buys food from home every day.

tasks.explanation: 'Sometimes' means not always, but on certain occasions. Option 2 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A boy talks about his father. His father is a doctor. He usually comes home at seven.
tasks.transcript: He usually comes home at seven.

options.text: His father never comes home at seven.
His father always comes home at nine.
His father comes home at seven most days.
His father rarely comes home at seven.

tasks.explanation: 'Usually' means most of the time. Option 3 says he comes home at seven on most days.

tasks.audioText: A woman talks about the weather in her city. It rains a lot. It often rains in November.

options.text: It never rains in November.
It rarely rains in November.
It snows often in November.
It rains frequently in November.

tasks.explanation: 'Often' means frequently, many times. Option 4 says the same thing.

tasks.audioText: A man talks about his eating habits. He likes healthy food. I rarely eat fast food.

options.text: He eats fast food very often.
He eats fast food almost never.
He never eats any food.
He always eats fast food.

tasks.explanation: 'Rarely' means almost never, very infrequently. Option 2 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A student talks about her English class. She enjoys it. Our teacher always explains things clearly.
tasks.transcript: Our teacher always explains things clearly.

options.text: The teacher sometimes explains clearly.
The teacher explains clearly every time.
The teacher rarely explains things.
The teacher never explains clearly.

tasks.explanation: 'Always explains clearly' means every single time. Option 2 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A couple talks about vacations. They love traveling. We usually go to the beach in summer.
tasks.transcript: We usually go to the beach in summer.

options.text: They go to the mountains in summer most years.
They go to the beach in summer most years.
They never go to the beach.
They go to the beach in winter most years.

tasks.explanation: 'Usually go to the beach in summer' means most years they choose the beach. Option 2.

tasks.audioText: A boy talks about his pet cat. The cat is lazy. It never catches mice.

options.text: The cat catches mice every day.
The cat sometimes catches mice.
The cat does not catch mice at all.
The cat often catches mice.

tasks.explanation: 'Never catches mice' means it does not happen. Option 3 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A woman works in an office. She likes her job. I often stay late on Fridays.
tasks.transcript: I often stay late on Fridays.

options.text: She never works late on Fridays.
She always leaves early on Fridays.
She frequently works late on Fridays.
She rarely stays at the office.

tasks.explanation: 'Often stay late' means she frequently works late on Fridays. Option 3 says the same.

tasks.audioText: A man talks about his morning commute. The traffic is bad. The bus is sometimes late.

options.text: The bus is always on time.
The bus is always late.
The bus is late on certain days.
The bus never arrives.

tasks.explanation: 'Sometimes late' means it happens on some days but not all. Option 3 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A girl talks about her grandmother. She lives nearby. I always visit her on Saturdays.
tasks.transcript: I always visit her on Saturdays.

options.text: She visits her grandmother every Saturday.
She visits her grandmother once a month.
She rarely visits her grandmother.
She visits her grandmother on Sundays.

tasks.explanation: 'Always visit on Saturdays' means every single Saturday. Option 1 is correct.

tasks.audioText: A man talks about his exercise routine. He goes to the gym. I usually run for thirty minutes.
tasks.transcript: I usually run for thirty minutes.

options.text: He runs for thirty minutes most of the time.
He never runs at the gym.
He runs for an hour most of the time.
He sometimes runs for ten minutes.

tasks.explanation: 'Usually run for thirty minutes' — 'usually' means most of the time. Option 1 matches.

tasks.audioText: A woman talks about cooking. She enjoys making pasta. I rarely use a recipe book.
tasks.transcript: I rarely use a recipe book.

options.text: She uses a recipe book almost every time.
She almost never uses a recipe book.
She always uses a recipe book.
She lost her recipe book.

tasks.explanation: 'Rarely' means almost never. She does not use a recipe book often. Option 2.

tasks.audioText: A boy talks about his weekday mornings. He wakes up at six thirty. I often eat cereal for breakfast.
tasks.transcript: I often eat cereal for breakfast.

options.text: He eats cereal for breakfast frequently.
He never eats breakfast.
He always eats toast for breakfast.
He rarely eats cereal.

tasks.explanation: 'Often eat cereal' means he frequently has cereal for breakfast. Option 1 is correct.

short_description: Тренируйте понимание наречий частотности на слух.
